characters: THROUGH THE TWISTING VEINS OF LIGHT BENEATH --
"BRING IT ON HOME TO ME" BY SAM COOKE PLAYS.
THE ENTIRE REAR UPPER QUADRANT OF THE ECLECTOR DETACHES F
MUSIC ON THE WALKMAN TOGETHER, EACH WITH ONE EAR PIECE.
THE SOVEREIGN FIRE UPON THE MILANO.
O.S. A CRACK OF INTERDIMENSIONAL THUNDER
THE FIRST TIME, SMILING AS THE AIR RUSHES THROUGH THEIR H
DISCS SEND ELECTRICITY COURSING THROUGH ALL OF THE MEN'S
A CHUNK OF THE REAR OF THE CRAFT DISAPPEARS.
THE ENTIRE HOLLOW AROUND THEM BEGINS TO RUMBLE. THE GRO
PETER'S ARM AS HE TEACHES HIM HOW TO SHOOT.
BABY GROOT CLUTCHES HAPPILY ONTO QUILL'S BACK.
I/E. LASER DRILL/CRACK IN THE PLANET
AND THE LASERS BEAM OUT OF THE SHIP IN ALL DIRECTIONS AT
OUT OF NEBULA'S BODY INTO THE VEHICLE --
THERE IS A BLINDING BURST OF LIGHT AND ALL OF THE OMNICRA
AND CONTINUING TO SPILL FORWARD, SPREADING.
QUILL PULLS OUT HIS PISTOLS AND FIRES
SOVEREIGN OMNICRAFT ARE POPPING THROUGH JUMP POINTS ABOVE
YONDU IS FLYING TOWARDS HIM ON AN AERO-RIG.
A HUGE CHUNK OF SPACESHIP FLIES IN FROM THE SIDE, FLATTEN
AND THE GIANT LASER DRILL COMES SMASHING THROUGH THE PALA
YONDU'S ARROW FLYING THROUGH THE TREES, DIRECTLY TOWARD H
ASTEROIDS, SWIRLING IN RANDOM PATTERNS, DISAPPEARING OUT
I/E. MILANO LIVING AREA/DIRECTLY ABOVE BERHERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD SHOT: A `79 Cobra winds alongside the Missouri River, past swaying loosestrife, vibrant sugar maples, an oily self-pump gas stations. A hazy sun glints off the ho of the Cobra which, like its descendant the Milano, is or and teal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE DOWN AND IN on a fresh-faced girl of 18 in the passenger seat: MEREDITH QUILL. As "Brandy" blasts from t car stereo, she pushes her fine, feathered hair from her mouth, and sings along, out-of-tune -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do do do do do do do do do do do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, a MYSTERIOUS MAN in his 30's, dressed in slee mod attire, LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meredith LAUGHS too. She SINGS and dances with abandon in her seat. She's a lively goofball, and it's apparent wher Peter Quill received much of his personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cobra pulls beside this Dairy Queen in a desolate are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mysterious Man helps Meredith down the steep hillside into the woods. "Brandy" continues to play on the car ste in the lot behind them. Meredith GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, my river lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mysterious Man shows her a STRANGE SPROUT nestled amo the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few inches tall and decidedly alien in nature, its deli limbs twist and turn in a complex pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mysterious Man looks proudly at Meredith. With a perpetually excited glint in his eye, and the air of a se empowerment guru, he is an intoxicating presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid it wouldn't take to the soil, but it rooted quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods toward the sky between the branches above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon it will be everywhere - all across the universe, fulfilling life's one true purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mysterious Man takes her in his arms.    He gazes int eyes. She grows almost teary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what you're talking about. But I like the way you say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart is yours, Meredith Quill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I fell in love with a spaceman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they KISS, with passion, and love. "DO DO DO DO DO DO DO DO DO DO!" sings Looking Glass as SOURCE BECOMES SCORE we TILT DOWN to the plant. It TWITCHES AND GROWS AND TWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN ON IT, where we see the plant is made, not onl cellulose and leaves, but of a BRIGHT COSMIC LIGHT. And w KEEPING PUSHING IN, INTO THE PLANT ITSELF, more FLESH-LIK than you'd imagine, where COLORFUL BACTERIA OVERCOMES US "BRANDY" DISTORTS AND TRANSFORMS into something epic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: 34 Years Later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An artificial, golden planet, made of interlocking orbs, revolves around a blue sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on THUNDEROUS INTERDIMENSIONAL CRACKS on one s patch of planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DIMENSIONAL CRACK SNAPS in the sky overhead. PETER QUIL looks from it to an old MATTEL ELECTRONICS FOOTBALL GAME converted into a tracker. A RED DOT APPROACHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showtime, a-holes! It'll be here any minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which will be its loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill turns toward GAMORA, loading a rifle. DRAX, ROCKET, and BABY GROOT also ready themselves for battle in this grand, open-air power station. Dozens of BATTERIES are couched in conductor towers encircling them. Quill, Gamor and Rocket wear flying rigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a rifle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what a rifle is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your thing was a sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been hired to stop an interdimensional beast from feeding on those batteries' energy, and I'm going to stop it with a sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself) Don't look at me like I'm stupid. You're the one being all inconsistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUDER, LARGER CRACK: something seems to be fighting it way through the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax, why aren't you wearing one of Rocket's aero-rigs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have sensitive nipples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket, who is working on a pair of speakers wired to Qui Walkman, LAUGHS HARD at this. Drax points at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?! What's he doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I finish this, we can listen to tunes while we work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that a priority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame Quill! He's the one who loves music so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree with Drax. It's hardly important right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, okayyyy, Quill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket WINKS at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really agree with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket WINKS some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can clearly see you winking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I'm using my left eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket hears a small GROWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down and sees Baby Groot - newly unpotted, only inches tall or so - angrily THROWING ASIDE some foraging Orloni. Then he looks up at Rocket, explaining:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Groot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were not looking at you funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket swirls as a GIGANTIC BEAST - a hundred-foot-long Lovecraftian monstrosity - BREAKS THROUGH THE INTERDIMENSIONAL RIFT. THE ABILISK is the color of a pink mouse with kaleidoscopic and deadly SPLATTER MATTER pulsi from its maw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That's intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket, Quill, and Gamora JET-PACK OUT OF THE WAY, while BLAST at the creature. Drax HOLLERS, CHARGING it with his twin blades. Quill TURNS ON his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we FOCUS on baby Groot, who trots up to the stereo speakers and Walkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fiddles with two wires. They SPARK, the stereo POWERS and "MR. BLUE SKY" by ELECTRIC LIGHT ORCHESTRA PLAYS as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Groot DANCES IN-FOCUS in the foreground as the Guard get PUMMELED by the beast OUT-OF-FOCUS in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Groot's dancing is arrhythmic and many of his "dance moves" are nonsensical mixtures of trembling, swaying, an making weird faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is joyous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Groot struts, Quill comes ROLLING behind him. As he stands, he sees Groot dancing and looks at him, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot, look - !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TENTACLE FLIES IN FROM OFF-SCREEN, KNOCKING Quill OUT-O FRAME as Groot dances on, blissfully unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot, smiling, dances onward, as DRAX, in the clutches o giant tentacle, is SLAMMED NUMEROUS TIMES BESIDE HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot arrives at GAMORA, who is blasting at the OFF-SCREE BEAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way, Groot! You're going to get hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot stops dancing.    He WAVES at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She AERO-JETS back into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Groot DANCES, Drax FALLS directly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax stares at him a moment, suspicious. Groot stays froz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax LEAVES, and Groot COMMENCES THE DANCE where he left

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot sees an INSECT FLYING BY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly dancing is forgotten and GETTING THIS BUG is all important. He CHASES it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HOPS up and grabs it from the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And starts EATING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket spots this and FLIES DOWN beside him, worried. He PRIES OPEN GROOT'S MOUTH with his fingers, frantically tr to get it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit it out! Spit it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot COUGHS IT OUT. The bug FLIES crookedly away, one wi mulched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket JETS OFF back toward the battle, muttering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot sees something else and becomes furious. We follow line of sight to a GRAZING ORLONI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot SCREAMS A WAR CRY and ATTACKS IT. He GROWS HIS BRANCHES AROUND IT, and the terrified Orloni DARTS AWAY, DRAGGING GROOT WITH IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot's anger becomes panic as he is DRAGGED AROUND BY TH ORLONI and can't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orloni DARTS around the power station and underneath RAGING BATTLE, a CRYING Groot bouncing along behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he LETS GO and goes TUMBLING, ROLLING directly I THE CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then stands up and, as if none of it happened at all, starts DANCING AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN and see the speakers and Walkman beside him, and w realize Baby Groot has traveled around the entire Power Station and has arrived back where he started -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Drax is FLUNG by the beast into the stereo system, SMASHING it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot stops dancing. Angry that Drax has ruined his fun, picks up a piece of the stereo and beats him with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax stands and glares at the ferocious beast as Rocket, Quill, and Gamora BLAST at it without effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast's hide is too thick to be pierced from the outside. I must cut through it from the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax HOLLERS, CHARGING the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax, no! That doesn't make -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature OPENS ITS ENORMOUS MOUTH, SCREECHING, and Dr LEAPS INSIDE IT, instantly swallowed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said the skin is too thick to be pierced from the outside, so he --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make sense!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to tell -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its skin is the same thickness from the inside as from the out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I REALIZE THAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax HOLLERS as he SLASHES AWAY inside the goo of the bea stomach. To no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill reloads his pistol, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora, there's a cut on its neck - Rocket, get it to look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill and Rocket JET UP HIGH up over the creature as they BLAST REPEATEDLY at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you giant Sea Monkey, up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora's rifle is jammed.    She tosses it down.   PULLS SWORD. SNAPS IT OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast SCREECHES at Quill and Rocket FLYING overhead. colorful SPLATTER MATTER FLIES FROM ITS MOUTH, BATTERING ROCKET, BURNING his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But its neck is exposed, where the skin is thinner, and t is a small wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora DASHES, LEAPING HIGH into the air, and she PLUNGES sword directly into the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds tight to the hilt as she FALLS, SLICING AN INCI down the length of the creature's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast WOBBLES, TOPPLES, and DIES. As it COLLAPSES, Dr SPILLS OUT of the wound. He raises his arms in victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha! I have single-handedly vanquished the beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill SCOFFS. Rocket SNORTS. Gamora stares at him, dead-e Baby Groot throws a rock at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardians de-rig by the Anulax batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they called again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anulax batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harbulary batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nothing like what I just said. But they're worth thousands of units a piece. Which is why the Sovereign hired us to protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket pulls out one of the ANULAX BATTERIES, checking it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora, Drax, and Quill walk on. Rocket stays back a mome Quill nods down the walkway, where GOLDEN SOVEREIGN CITIZ stand at the edge of the station, gawking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be careful what you say around these folks. They're easily offended and the cost of transgression is death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds judgmental for a bunch of golden morons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the kind of thing you might want to keep to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hold my tongue, as long as they deliver what was promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous golden palace in the shape of a globe, dapple morning sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thank you, Guardians, for putting your life on the line. We could not risk the lives of our own Sovereign citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH PRIESTESS AYESHA is stunningly beautiful with golden skin. Her CHAMBERMAIDS and other DENIZENS flutter through her luxurious lair, all of whom are equally perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every citizen is born exactly as designed by the community, impeccable, both physically and mentally. We control the DNA of our progeny, germinating them in birthing pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I prefer making people the old-fashioned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... perhaps someday you could give me a history lesson in the archaic ways of our ancestors... for academic purposes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, if it's for research that could be pretty --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill sees Gamora staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty repulsive. I'm not into that kind of casual -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your people promised something in trade for our services. Bring it and we shall gladly be on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayesha nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two SOLDIERS emerge with A WOMAN in a hood and cloak, her wrists bound by SHACKLES. They SHOVE HER TO HER KNEES and yank back her hood, REVEALING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEBULA. Her clothes are tattered.    Her hand is now just tech metal claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glares at Gamora. Gamora glares at her. Quill looks f one to the other, feeling the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family reunion. Yaaaay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand she is your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora roughly picks Nebula up, starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's worth no more to me than the bounty due for her on Xandar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our soldiers apprehended her attempting to steal the batteries. Do with her as you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, High Priestess Ayesha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your heritage, Mr. Quill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill turns back towards her, uncomfortable with the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother is from earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's... not from Missouri, that's all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayesha stares at him as if she's eaten something foul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it within you, an unorthodox genealogy. A hybrid that seems particularly... reckless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill tries not to let this affect him, but it does. Rock grins a huge, fake grin at Ayesha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they told me you people were conceited douchebags. But that isn't true at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket turns to Quill and WINKS.   The Guardians shift uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, I'm using my wrong eye again, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was meant to be behind your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax YANKS Rocket away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora and Quill head out of the lair. Drax and Rocket ar few paces behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count yourself blessed they didn't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me. You wanna buy some batteries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket grins and shows Drax something hidden in his bag - ANULAX BATTERIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "LAKE SHORE DRIVE" by ALIOTTA, HAYNES, AND JEREMIAH PLAYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax LAUGHS. Rocket SHUSHES him so Quill and Gamora don't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Milano RISES into the blue sunset over the Sovereign Space Dock filled with golden, capsule-shaped ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket works the controls as they rise up. He speaks into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get baldy back to Xandar and retrieve that bounty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot lies on the rear window peering out the back as the pass overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the CASSETTE PLAYER AWESOME MIX VOL. 2 is playing; we away from it, MOVING IN on Quill, looking perturbed as he takes off his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora is nearby, putting shackles on Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff about my father. Who does she think she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're sensitive about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sensitive about it. I just don't know who he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry if it looked like I was flirting with her. I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora pushes Nebula to the rear of the craft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do care. That's why I'm apologizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill watches her go, somewhat longingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora is not the one for you, Quill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill is startled to see Drax directly beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two types of beings in the universe. Those who dance, and those who do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I first met my beloved at a war rally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the village flailed about, dancing. Except one woman. My Ovette. I knew immediately she was the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill nods, trying to be polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most melodic song in the world could be playing, and she wouldn't even tap her foot. She wouldn't move a muscle. One might assume she was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that is pretty hot, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would make my nether regions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, okay, fascinating, don't need to hear it. I get your point, I'm a dancer and Gamora is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax smiles kindly, clutches Quill's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to find a woman who is pathetic, like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the rear of the ship, Gamora roughly restrains Nebula. Nebula notices a bowl of fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hungry. Hand me some of that yaro root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not ripe yet. And I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate me?! You left me there while you stole that stone for yourself. Yet here you stand, a hero, a Garden of the Galaxy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebula stares at her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Guardians of the Galaxy.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would we be `the Gardens of the Galaxy'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I thought it was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still wordy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't the one who thought of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name doesn't matter. I'll be free of these shackles soon enough, and I'll kill you, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You'll live out your days in a prison on Xandar, wishing you could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora MOVES UP from the stairs. Rocket and Quill are in pilot seats. Drax is moving up from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got an armed Sovereign fleet, approaching from the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora takes the center seat, sees a REARVIEW SCAN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golden, capsule-shaped, Sovereign OMNICRAFT, with a video screen on front and a blaster on each side - getting clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they do that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably because Rocket stole some of their batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill and Gamora look at Rocket, astounded.    Rocket gaw Drax, betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. He didn't steal one of those. I don't know why they're after us. What a mystery this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill does his best to evade their blasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it was really easy to steal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You saw how that high- priestess talked down to us! I'm teaching her a lesson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I didn't realize your motivation was altruism. A shame the Sovereign have mistaken your intentions and are trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WAS BEING SARCASTIC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! You tricked me! You're supposed to use a sarcastic voice! Now I look foolish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax points at Rocket and LAUGHS at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP, DRAX! You knew! You should have told us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax is aghast. He looks at Rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him it was easy to steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never listen to anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of you listens! Can we please just put the bickering on hold until after we survive the massive space battle?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket glances at Quill, nodding back at Gamora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Somebody woke up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not try to bro down with me right now, dude. I will fricking punch you in your fricking face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real nice! Resorting to violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More incoming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE SHIP FLY AT THEM from the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOOD! I WANT TO KILL SOME GUYS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They twist and turn between the oncoming ships as ROCKET FIRES AT THEM, SCREAMING. They EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the front of the Sovereign ships is the VIDEO IMAGE OF PILOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same SOVEREIGN PILOT sits in a REMOTE POD. On a SCREE front of her we see ROCKET FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP IS HIT and the SCREEN GOES STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot SHOUTS in anger, like a kid who lost at a video game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Priestess Ayesha surveys from a walkway above; ROWS PODS containing PILOTS, all flying their Omnicraft remote

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not killing anyone. Those ships are all remotely piloted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOVEREIGN ADMIRAL is beside Ayesha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the delay, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Priestess, if we destroy their craft, we risk destroying the batteries. They're extraordinarily combustible and could, in turn, destroy the entire fleet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have thousands of batteries and thousands of ships. Our concern is their slight against our people. We hired them and they steal from us? It is heresy of the highest order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral speaks into his comm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All command modules -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FRIGHTENED SOVEREIGN PILOT, on the outskirts of the bat hears the Admiral in his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire with the intent to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEAN SOVEREIGN PILOT, FIRING at the Milano, smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MILANO'S WING IS STRUCK.   The EMERGENCY SYSTEMS FLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the closest habitable planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora dances her fingers over the UNIVERSAL NEURAL TELEPORTATION NETWORK, clicking through "jump points" unt she finds one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Berhert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many jumps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one. But the access point is 47 clicks away. And it's through that Quantum Asteroid Field over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill spots, to his side, a HUGE FIELD OF SMALL, GLOWING

dialogues.speaker: ASTEROIDS, SWIRLING IN RANDOM PATTERNS, DISAPPEARING OUT
dialogues.text: SPACE and EMERGING AGAIN a few feet or a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill ZOOMS SIDEWAYS toward the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill, to make it through that, you'd have to be the greatest pilot in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for us -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket FLIPS the pilot controls between them so that he's one piloting the ship. Quill gapes at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Milano DIVES into the QUANTUM ASTEROID FIELD, SWOOPIN and around the SWIRLING ATOMIZED STONES, barely missing t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sovereign ships FOLLOW. They are not pilots on par wi Rocket, so most of the ships are immediately PELTED WITH STONES AND DESTROYED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One after another the SOVEREIGN PILOTS screens go blank, they FALL BACK, angry and upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Ayesha, barely containing her fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill FLIPS the controls back, so he's piloting again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been flying this rig since I was ten years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was cybernetically engineered to pilot a spacecraft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket FLIPS the controls back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were cybernetically engineered to be a douchebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill FLIPS the controls back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill, later on tonight you're gonna lay down in your bed and there's gonna be something squishy in your pillowcase and you're gonna be, like, `what's this?' and it's gonna be because I put a turd in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket FLIPS the switch back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put your turd in my bed, I shave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it won't be my turd, it will be Drax's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax LAUGHS cheerfully. Gamora glances at him. He explain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have famously huge turds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to die, and this is what we're discussing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise havoc with the pipes. That's why I do all the plumbing. I take responsibility for my actions. Unlike some people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax eyes baby Groot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot, he's right, you have to start aiming inside the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot looks ashamed. Quill FLIPS the controls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket SWITCHES it back. Quill SWITCHES it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nearing the end of the Asteroid Field when both g switch it at the same time and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! A LARGE ASTEROID SMASHES THROUGH the stern of the Milano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebula IS SUCKED toward the hole - but, fortunately, her are shackled to a post, so she doesn't fly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face and body cover with frost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything FLIES AROUND THE SPACECRAFT, RUSHING THROUGH T HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot GOES FLYING, but Quill CATCHES HIM, and casually TO him back to Drax --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that he can punch in a code, causing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PROTECTIVE ENERGY SHIELD SLIDES UP in front of the hole Nebula COLLAPSES to the floor. She yells upstairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone catches their breath, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what you get when Quill flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora THROWS SOMETHING HARD at the back of Rocket's head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still a Sovereign craft behind us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electronics FLICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our weapons are down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty clicks to the jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Pilot BLASTS at them from the sole Sovereign Cra TAKING OUT another part of a wing. The Milano is TREMBLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax starts climbing down into the living area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of pilots have gathered around the Mean Pilot, rooting him on, like kids at a video arcade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Zylak, you can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebula sees the bowl of yaro root has spilled in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for a piece, but it's KICKED OUT OF HER WAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up to see Drax, grabbing a cable on a spool attached to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax HOOKS the cable to his belt. A folder on the wall re SPACESUITS FOR EMERGENCY and, below that, in Rocket's scr OR FOR FUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax pulls a small disk from the folder. He slaps it betw his shoulder blades and a SHIMMERY SHEATH COVERS HIS ENTI BODY - a thin force-field spacesuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora watches THE MAP leading to the jump point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BLAST from the Sovereign craft HITS them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilots rooting on the Mean Pilot erupt into CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax grabs a huge rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches buttons on the wall. A SECOND PROTECTIVE SHIEL OPENS UP between him and Nebula, and THE FIRST PROTECTIVE SHEATH OPENS, exposing him to space --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Pilot watches in awe as Drax JUMPS OUT the back the Milano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax smiles. The cable UNSPOOLS and SNAPS TAUT when it reaches its end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax is DRAGGED HAPHAZARDLY by the Milano like a water sl on a boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MAP, the jump point gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten clicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Pilot BLASTS WILDLY at Drax, missing him by mere inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax brings the sight to his eye.   Aims at the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die, spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he SHOOTS, BLASTING the Sovereign ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mean Pilot SCREAMS as his lights go out. The Frighten Pilot shakes his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suck, Zylak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zylak is really sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Quill and Rocket leave the asteroid field, it seems fo moment they're scot-free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five clicks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then DOZENS OF OMNICRAFT pull around them on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-! They went around the field!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayesha smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like the end of the road for the Guardians when

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayesha watches in shock as the screens in the pods go dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone destroyed all the ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! WHO?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Admiral doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket sees the BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT is emanating from an O SHAPED SPACECRAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill sees the FLICKERING framework of a JUMP POINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter! That's the jump point! GO! GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they're about to reach the jump point, Rocket sees a M standing casually atop the oval ship, LIGHT BURSTING THRO HIS BODY and into the craft - the source of the explosion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill doesn't see as the Milano DISAPPEARS INTO THE JUMP POINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship POPS IN HERE, TELEPORTING directly above the ear like planet. Because the ship is in such bad shape, parts it TEAR OFF AND SPIRAL AWAY as it enters this new atmosph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora sees Drax being dragged in the REARVIEW MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax WHIPS WILDLY OUT of the back of the ship.   The CABL SPOOL on the wall is coming off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill sees a green forest APPROACHING UNBELIEVABLY FAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns toward Gamora, but she's gone. Instead Baby Groo is sitting alone, happily munching on candies as if he's watching a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot, put on your seat belt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPOOL DETACHES and FLIES toward the back, which would leave Drax in the upper reaches of the planet's atmospher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gamora has made it downstairs - she GRABS ONTO THE SP with one hand while CLUTCHING onto a secure part of the s with her other. As it SNAPS TIGHT, it nearly wrenches her apart. She GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare for a really bad -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Milano HITS THE TREES, BARRELING OVER THEM.    They P and FLATTEN and SWAT at the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back, Gamora HOLDS TIGHT despite searing pain, as Dra BOUNCES VIOLENTLY off the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, eventually, the Milano comes to an ABRUPT STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax pushes himself up in the dirt. He CHUCKLES.    He gl back at Gamora like the madman he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora nods, sure, yeah, okay, whatever, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN OVER THE SMOKING, BATTERED MILANO TO our heroe and a still-shackled Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either one    of you could have gotten us through    that field, if you had flown with    what's between your ears instead of    what's between your legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If what's between my legs had a hand on it, I guarantee I could have landed this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not funny, Peter. We almost died. Because of your arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like because he stoled Anulax batteries!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're called Harbulary batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I did it, Star-Munch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to answer to `Star- Munch.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I DID IT BECAUSE I WANTED TO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we even talking about this for? We just had a little man save us by blowing up fifty ships!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket shows him with his finger and thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little one-inch man saved us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if he got closer I'm sure he'd be much larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how eyes work, you stupid raccoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me a raccoon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I meant to say `trash panda.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket pauses, unsure, looks at Drax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU SON-OF-A-!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket LEAPS, SNAPPING at Quill, when Nebula looks up int the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone followed you through the jump point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE SPACESHIP HOVERS overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardians COCK THEIR WEAPONS as they FALL BACK-TO-BAC tight formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set me free. You'll need my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a fool, Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fool if you deprive yourself a hand in combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll attack me the moment I let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbly, unconvincing) No, I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think an evil supervillain would learn how to properly lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet it's the one-inch man!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP LANDS, CRUSHING ALL OF THE TREES AROUND IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HATCH OPENS, and an adventurous, outer space frontiersm steps forward. He has grown hardened and haggard over the years, but he is definitely the MYSTERIOUS MAN from the beginning of the film. MANTIS, a creepy woman with antenn emerges behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all these years, I've found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured my rugged good looks would make that obvious. My name's Ego. And I'm your Dad, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUIET. A planet of mostly water and white icy patches of land, revolving around two overlapping suns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW FALLS GENTLY over this sleepy, pastel-colored town o wood and stone buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on the Iron Lotus, a robot brothel and saloon. ASSORTED RAVAGERS, including KRAGLIN, as well as some ROB COURTESANS, are drunk and GIGGLING, trying to catch snowflakes on their tongues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YONDU UDONTA is staring out the window as he puts on his pants. He looks utterly disconnected and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him are three ROBOT COURTESANS.   One pushes a but on her neck and she POWERS DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu! Come on down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu looks down at the street where an older Ravager, TU drunkenly dances, waving for him to join.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu exits his suite. Two bodyguards, BRAHL and HALF-NUT salute and follow him as he descends the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the stairs a group of RAVAGERS in BLUE UNIFORMS LAUGH. A gruff, older warrior, STAKAR, and a man seemingly made of diamonds, MARTINEX are among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu stops when he sees them. He's struck. Stakar LAUGHS he tells a story -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was like, Aleta, I love you, but you're crazy now, you always

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu approaches Stakar with trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar is surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been some time. I'd -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like this establishment is the wrong kind of disreputable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue-coats turn and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar glances at the PROPRIETOR as he passes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a hundred Ravager factions, Sneeper. You just lost the business of ninety-nine by serving one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sir! Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu stands there for a moment, hurt, as they head out t door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, little by little, his hurt turns to rage and he FOLL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu trots quickly toward Stakar and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all can go to hell! I don't care what you think of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar swirls toward him, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why you following us for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you'll listen to what I got to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't got to listen to nothing! You betrayed the code! Ravagers don't deal in kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what was going on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know `cause you didn't want to know, `cause it made you rich!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand a seat at the table! I wear the flames same as you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may dress like a Ravager but you won't hear no Horns of Freedom when you die, boy, and the Colors of Ogord will not flash over your grave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I take some pleasure in exiling you, you're wrong. You broke all our hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakar and the others storm away. Martinex stays a moment staring at Yondu, and then moves on too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu is left alone, shaken as the WHITE SNOW FALLS GENTL his blue face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEARBY, a MONSTROUS RAVAGER leans in toward Kraglin, Tull GEF THE RAVAGER, OBLO, and RETCH. As he eyes Yondu, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Quill betrays us and Yondu just lets him go, scot-free. Now he's getting all riled over nothing. We followed him `cause he was the one wasn't afraid to do what needed to be done. Seems like he's going soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's so soft why you whispering for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm right, Kraglin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best watch what you say about the Cap'n, Tay -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tullk stops when he sees High Priestess Ayesha approachin beside them. The Chambermaids ROLL OUT a LONG BLUE CLOTH she doesn't touch unconsecrated ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She STOPS at the carpet's end. Does her best to force a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu Udonta, I have a proposition for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your mother passed away, I hired Yondu to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill sits around a campfire with Ego, Mantis and the oth eating. Ego indulges heartily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have done so myself, but I was in the midst of an outlandish adventure at the time, battling demonic forces to save this dimension or some such nonsense - I can't quite recall, it all bleeds together after awhile. But instead of returning you, Yondu kept you. I have no clue as to why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was a skinny kid who could squeeze into places adults couldn't, making thieving easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to track you down ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Yondu was your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been together all this time and you thought Yondu was my actual, blood relative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look exactly alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't my father. Yondu was the guy who abducted me. He'd beat the crap out of me so I'd learn how to fight and he kept me in terror threatening to eat me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you locate us now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even where I reside, out past the edge of what's known, we've heard tell of the man they call Star- Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, handing his dish to Gamora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say we head out that way now? Your associates are welcome, even that triangle-faced monkey there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket, self-conscious, feels his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, it's like no place you've ever seen. And there I can explain your very special heritage, and finally be the father I've always wanted to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Scuse me. I gotta take a whizz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego leaves.   Quill looks at Gamora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not buying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, we need to take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego is WHISTLING "BRANDY" and PEEING into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis looks at Drax. She GRINS, or at least her best att at grinning. It's kind of creepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Mantis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling. I hear it is the thing to do to make people like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you do it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I was raised alone on Ego's planet. I do not understand the intricacies of social interaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points at Rocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I pet your puppy? It is adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to pet Rocket: startled, he SWIRLS and SNAPS at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back her hand. Drax LAUGHS, heartily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's called a practical joke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it very much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both LAUGH together. Nebula shakes her head with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill and Gamora enter this private spot; the campfire flickers through the trees beyond them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break! After all this time, and he just expects to be my Dad all of the sudden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, this could be a trap - the Kree purists, the Ravagers, now the Sovereign - they all want us dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that story you told me about Zardu Hasselfrau?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wonderful television-singer man. He had a magic boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Hasselhoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a talking car, not a magic -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did it talk again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to be a good friend, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a child you carried his picture in your pocket, and you told the other children he was your father, but he was out of town --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Knight Rider or touring with his band in Germany. Why are you bringing this up now? I was drunk when I told you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. It's just sad! I was so sad because I'd see the other kids off playing catch with their dads, and I wanted that, more than anything in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora takes Quill's hands in her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My point is, maybe this man is your Hasselhoff. I know it's a long shot. But I lost my father as a child. I'd give anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill nods, grudgingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he ends up being evil, we'll just kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the ship, "THE CHAIN" BY FLEETWOOD MAC PLAYS on th cassette player. Nebula is angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving me with that fox?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket is SOLDERING the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora glances at Rocket as she grabs her outer-space- adventurer version of luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot her if she does anything suspicious. Or if you feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket GRUNTS.    Gamora looks at a sad Baby Groot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will just be a couple days. We'll be back before Rocket's finished fixing the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora steps out. Rocket sees Groot, who is ABOUT TO CRY he watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax and Quill come from the back of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your spool of songs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have clones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the Sovereign come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way for them to know they're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am uncertain about parting ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like an old woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I am wise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill turns to Rocket as Drax and Gamora head toward the ship. He starts to say something nice - perhaps something conciliatory but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope daddy isn't as big of a dick as you, orphan boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill just shakes his head and SNICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your goal here? To get everyone to hate you? `Cause it's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill turns back around with Gamora and Drax and walks aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket looks at the others leaving as THE SONG BECOMES SC I can still hear you saying you will never break the chai Rocket watches them move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN SLOW-MOTION, Quill, Drax, and Gamora approach the oval ship. The slit opens. Ego, with Mantis, is waiting inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego smiles and CLASPS his hand on Quill as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill sits back against the wall, alone, nervous. He look across the way at a SLEEP CHAMBER, where Mantis helps Ego down on a slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places her hand on his forehead with her hand: her antennae ALIGHT. And he drifts off to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill takes a small, folded piece of paper out of his poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the PHOTO OF DAVID HASSELHOFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at it, then looks at Ego.    Quill's eyes fill w cautious hope. And the SONG ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego's ship rises, blocking out the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orb moves through a rainbowish funnel of space and ti technology beyond what even the Guardians know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill and Drax are drinking tea and LAUGHING with Mantis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a personal question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no one has ever asked me a personal question!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The antennae, what are they for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora ENTERS, pouring herself some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Quill and I have a bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say that if you are about to go through a doorway that is too low, your antennae will feel this, and stop you from being decapitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just making clear - if it's anything else - any other answer - I win?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora smiles, warmed by the good-natured, by-now-familia bickering between Quill and Drax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are not for feeling doorways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. I just lost my entire life's savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three pairs of pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they have something to do with my empathic abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I touch someone I can feel their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read minds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Telepaths know thoughts. Empaths feel feelings. Emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Quill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill doesn't stop her. Mantis, cautiously, touches him. hand quivers as his emotions shoot through her and her antennae ALIGHT. She is moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess, yeah, I have sort of a general, unselfish love for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, romantic, sexual love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis nods at Gamora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora is embarrassed. Drax starts LAUGHING UPROARIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just told everyone your deepest, darkest secret, Quill! HAHAHAHAHAHA!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, dude? That's a total overreaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax SLAPS HIS CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO ME! DO ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis touches Drax. She grins brightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never felt such humor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts GIGGLING and before long both she and Drax are LAUGHING HYSTERICALLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax and Mantis both point at Quill, clutching onto each other and FALLING OVER WITH LAUGHTER. Quill's humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so incredibly uncool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis wipes the tears from her eyes, composing herself. goes to touch Gamora, who grabs her wrist though her clot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch me. And the only thing you're going to feel is a broken jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis smiles, nods, backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can also alter emotions, to some extent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I touch someone who is sad I can ease them into contentment, for a short while. I can make a stubborn person compliant. But I mostly use it to help my Master sleep. He lies awake at night, thinking about his progeny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quill looks at her, struck by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do one of those on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis touches him.    He grins expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax COLLAPSES, INSTANTLY ASLEEP. Mantis smiles at the others, hoping she has pleased. Quill and Gamora look at Drax, SNORING. They're surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of like someone put a baby's head on a big, muscular body, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four moons shine over the forest. The campfire CRACKLES beside the Milano, and "SOUTHERN NIGHTS" BY GLENN CAMPBEL emerges from the cassette player within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monstrous Ravager and Kraglin lead a group of Ravager over a ravine. Dozens of M-Ships quietly lower behind the Kraglin nods toward the sounds of Glenn Campbell in the distance. They raise their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD SHOT: dozens and dozens of Ravagers come from different directions, surrounding the Milano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Ravager cluster, lead by Half-Nut, CREEPS close enoug the Milano that they see the lights within the vehicle an can hear Rocket inside HUMMING along to the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-Nut licks his lips in anticipation, closing in for t kill, when he steps on a small pedal. It CLICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUNDRED DARTS FLY AT THE GROUP from traps set in trees. They STICK INTO THE RAVAGERS' BODIES, knocking them insta unconscious. As one Ravager FALLS, a GUNSHOT is discharge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebula is awakened by the SHOT. She sees a frightened Gro peering through a hole at the bodies falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL, beside him, a futuristic walkie-talk with ROCKET'S HUMS emerging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket is crouched on a limb in shadows above the Milano, smiling and HUMMING to "Southern Nights" into his comm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots A LARGER GROUP OF RAVAGERS APPROACHING THE MILAN from the other side, led by Retch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket LEAPS TOWARD THEM, from one tree limb to another l a squirrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GROUP enters a clearing close to the ship. A TALL RAV looks up and spots Rocket LEAPING OVER THEIR HEADS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ravagers BLAST at Rocket, following him. He HOPS from tree to tree as BULLETS WHIZZ PAST HIM, leading them righ where he wants them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops in a tree at the end of the run.   He holds a de with two buttons. He presses one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PERCUSSIVE BOMB at the feet of the Ravagers BURSTS, sen half of them FLYING UP into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the confused group on the ground watches, Rocket press the second button and a second BOMB BURSTS. They FLY UP I THE AIR as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket SNICKERS, as he continues pushes the buttons and t two groups of Ravagers FLY UP and DOWN until the bombs ar depleted of energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retch looks up from the ground, to see the little animal hopping away in the tree limbs overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EVEN LARGER GROUP OF RAVAGERS walk beneath the branche MOONLIGHT FLICKERING ON THEIR FACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP TO REVEAL ROCKET'S SILHOUETTE on a gnarled limb. clutching an armful of small discs. He breathes shallowly waits. As soon as the last Ravager is passing beneath him he LEAPS onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket JUMPS FORWARD FROM ONE MAN TO THE NEXT, SLAPPING A STICKY-DISC to each of their heads - SLAP! SLAP! SLAP! SL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he LEAPS from the Ravager at the front of the li BACK UP INTO THE TREES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are confused. They bring their fingers to the sti discs on their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket smiles in the tree as he flicks a trigger. The STI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They CONVULSE for a moment, then COLLAPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket LEAPS to the ground in a crouch. He sees Brahl approaching in front of him, and then another RAVAGER approaching from behind. They train their weapons on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't so tough now without all your toys, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket LEAPS up onto Brahl's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He PUNCHES HIM IN THE THORAX so hard he can't breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Ravager SHOOTS at him, but Rocket BACKFLIPS ove the SHOT so Brahl is STRUCK instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket LANDS on the back of the shooter's neck and RAPID- PUNCHES HIM in the head, until the man CRUMPLES to the ground, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rocket lands, he HEARS WHISTLING and he looks up to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another high-pitched WHISTLE and the arrow STOPS ABRUPTLY FLOATING with the tip almost grazing Rocket's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu waltzes out of the trees with Tullk, Kraglin, the Monstrous Ravager, and many more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket reluctantly raises his hands in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, you blue idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, not so bad. We got a pretty good gig. A golden gal with quite a high opinion of herself offered us a large sum to deliver you and your pals to her, so she can kill y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nebula looks out the window to see even more Ravagers surrounding Rocket. She looks at baby Groot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend. There's too many of them. They're going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot looks as if he's about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs my help. If you care about him, you need to get me out of these bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groot is unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ravagers have entirely encircled Rocket. There's no chance of escape. Though upset, he mostly holds it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty easy to find you, since we put a tracer on your ship back during the War over Xandar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give me your word you won't hurt Groot, and I'll tell you where the batteries are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for you my word don't mean squat. Otherwise I'd actually hand you over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise you'd what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu scowls at the Monstrous Ravager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the batteries. They're worth a a quarter mil on the open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That priestess offered us a million! A quarter is only one third of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quarter ain't one-th -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quarter is four times a million! We're in the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, idiot. A quarter is twenty- five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't even buy a pair of boots with twenty-five units!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, we aren't stupid enough to help kill the Guardians of the Galaxy. We'd have the whole Nova Corps on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't right. I just gotta say it this one time, Cap'n.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Kraglin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how many times Quill betrays you, you protect him, like none of the rest of us much matter. I'm the one what sticks up for you, me and Tullk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight, lad. You're right: he's going soft. S'pose it's time for a change in leadership!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monstrous Ravager points his weapon at Yondu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others follow his lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of others, including Tullk and the Innocent Ravager, raise their weapons in their Captain's defense, that the whole circle are aiming at one another. Kraglin confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put you damn guns down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket is in the center of the potential crossfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on! There's got to be some sort of peaceful resolution here! Or even a violent resolution, where I'm standing over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yondu glares at the Monstrous Ravager.   His FIN LIGHTS U he starts to WHISTLE when -

dialogues.speaker: A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT
dialogues.text: HEAD. The arrow CLATTERS to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocket watches as Yondu, confused, TOTTERS there for a moment, and then COLLAPSES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALING NEBULA behind him, clutching a smoking pistol. Rocket looks at her, dead-eyed: really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SHOOTS HIM WITH A BLAST OF ELECTRICITY, knocking him unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ravagers gape at Nebula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a bite from a piece of yaro root she stole from Milano. As she chews, she becomes disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spits it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego's ship ARRIVES at a bold red planet, twisting in fron an enormous yellow sun, so close it seems like the sun is about to devour it. "MY SWEET LORD" BY GEORGE HARRISON PL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantis sets her hand on Ego's forehead, waking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego's ship lands in a spaceport. It organically JOINS the spot where it lands - strands of material actually linkin with the landing pad itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the front of the craft, a FLOATING TRAM emerges, wit Ego, Mantis, Quill, Gamora, and Drax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TRAM GLIDES toward its destination, the Guardians overwhelmed by transcendentally splendid surroundings. Th plant life is colorful and alien. Tall, twisting obelisks seem to have no function other than beauty itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, friends, to my world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You have your own planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a trifle, no larger than your earth's moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humility. I like it. I too, am extraordinarily humble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Gamora smiles at the wonder of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multicolored mercurial clumps FLOAT BY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax pokes one, and it BURSTS INTO A DOZEN VIBRANT HUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of them looms an astounding palace atop a mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tram STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step off it and toward the palace, Ego stops beside large FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, consider this a token of a father's pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ego motions; the WATERS OF THE FOUNTAIN FALL AWAY, REVEAL a GIANT STATUE OF STAR-LORD: Quill stands heroically, wit foolish-looking Guardians kneeling around him worshipfull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A memorial to the War Over Xandar, when you single-handedly saved the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single-handedly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. It's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I dead? Why did you all kill me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ronan. That's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drax is sitting on Quill's shoulder, with a raccoon tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was I that tiny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamora shakes her head in disbelief. They step past the statue and onto the steps approaching the palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own a planet and can destroy two dozen spaceships without a suit. What are you, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
